metadata.title: CVE-2019-11338 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
libavcodec/hevcdec.c in FFmpeg 3.4 and 4.1.2 mishandles detection ofduplicate first slices, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (NULL pointer dereference and out-of-array access) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via crafted HEVC data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.1.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.1.3-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.1.3-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.1.3-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.1.3-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.1.3-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.1.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.1.3-1').
